ward-01.problem: Heavy vehicular congestion in central business district
ward-01.description: Implement variable congestion pricing for vehicles entering the central area during peak hours, similar to London's system.
ward-01.impact: Expected 20-30% reduction in vehicle traffic and 15-20% improvement in air quality during peak hours.

ward-01.description: Mandate anti-smog guns, covered material transport, and real-time dust monitoring at all construction sites.
ward-01.impact: Potential 40% reduction in construction-related PM emissions.

ward-01.problem: Limited green cover in commercial area
ward-01.description: Require new commercial buildings to have 30% rooftop green cover and provide tax incentives for existing buildings.
ward-01.impact: Improved local microclimate and 10-15% reduction in urban heat island effect.

ward-02.description: Halt non-essential construction during severe pollution days and mandate wet excavation methods.
ward-02.impact: 25-35% reduction in construction dust during high pollution periods.

ward-02.problem: Dense traffic due to commercial activities
ward-02.description: Require all commercial deliveries in the ward to use electric vehicles by 2025.
ward-02.impact: 40% reduction in commercial vehicle emissions within the ward.

ward-02.problem: Open waste burning in unauthorized dumps
ward-02.description: Deploy round-the-clock monitoring, impose heavy fines, and establish material recovery facilities.
ward-02.impact: Complete elimination of open burning with proper waste processing.

ward-03.description: Provide subsidized loans and technical support for small industries to upgrade to cleaner technologies.
ward-03.impact: 50% reduction in industrial emissions over 3 years with economic sustainability.

ward-03.problem: Congested narrow lanes with heavy goods vehicles
ward-03.description: Restrict heavy vehicles, implement pedestrian zones, and use electric rickshaws for local transport.
ward-03.impact: 60% reduction in vehicular pollution in heritage areas.

ward-03.problem: High waste generation with inadequate disposal
ward-03.description: Establish micro-composting centers and material recovery units within the ward.
ward-03.impact: 80% reduction in waste requiring transport and potential for open burning.

ward-04.problem: Major wholesale market generating heavy truck traffic
ward-04.description: Shift wholesale market loading/unloading to night hours with mandatory BS-VI vehicles.
ward-04.impact: 40% reduction in daytime pollution with efficient night logistics.

ward-04.description: Mandate returnable packaging, establish cardboard recycling, and ban single-use plastics.
ward-04.impact: 70% reduction in market waste with economic benefits from recycling.

ward-04.problem: Road dust from heavy vehicle movement
ward-04.description: Install mechanized road cleaning with regular water spraying on main routes.

ward-05.description: Deploy IoT sensors at construction sites linked to automatic compliance alerts.
ward-05.impact: Continuous compliance with immediate violation detection.

ward-05.description: Provide ward-level EV subsidies and mandate charging stations in new buildings.
ward-05.impact: 30% EV adoption within 3 years reducing vehicle emissions.

ward-05.description: Train and incentivize resident welfare associations to monitor and report waste burning.
ward-05.impact: Near-elimination of waste burning through community ownership.

ward-06.description: Require all new buildings to meet GRIHA 4-star rating with enhanced dust control.
ward-06.impact: 50% reduction in construction-related emissions with better building efficiency.

ward-06.description: Create dense tree plantation buffer between industrial and residential areas.
ward-06.impact: 20-30% reduction in pollutant transfer to residential areas.

ward-06.description: Establish construction debris recycling plant with mandatory debris collection.
ward-06.impact: Zero construction debris burning with recycled material market.

ward-07.description: Deploy AI-powered adaptive traffic signals to optimize flow and reduce idling.
ward-07.impact: 25% reduction in intersection pollution with improved traffic flow.

ward-07.description: Designate commercial areas as emission-free zones with EV-only delivery and transit.
ward-07.impact: 60% reduction in commercial area vehicle emissions.

ward-07.description: Introduce certification program with benefits for industries meeting emission standards.

ward-08.description: Create pedestrian priority zones with limited vehicle access during market hours.
ward-08.impact: 50% reduction in market area vehicle emissions.

ward-08.description: Set up biogas plant for organic market waste with energy fed back to market.

ward-08.description: Mandate enclosure and dust suppression for all building maintenance activities.

ward-09.description: Create dedicated green construction zone with centralized dust control and monitoring.
ward-09.impact: 45% reduction in construction-related pollution with better coordination.

ward-10.policy: River Bridge Toll with EV Exemption
ward-10.description: Implement congestion tolling on bridges with exemptions for EVs and public transport.
ward-10.impact: 30% reduction in bridge traffic with incentivized clean vehicles.

ward-10.description: Consolidate and modernize small industries in designated clean zones with shared infrastructure.
